section.title: Usage notes
section.p: In most cases explicit usage of lock() and unlock() should be avoided. Use class mutex_lock to manage locks instead. It provides exception safety and it's handy for usage.
In C++11 mode std::mutex can be a better alternative.

synopsis.p: Acquires a lock on the mutex. Waits until released if acquired by other thread at the moment.
Tries to lock the mutex. Immediately returns false if acquired by other thread, without waiting.
Releases the mutex acquired before. In some cases can return false in case of error, but in general error detection is not guaranteed.

chapter.p: Manages the lock on a mutex. The lock exists while the object is alive.

synopsis.p: Constructor tag, suppresses the lock acquisition.
